intro: Pygeum glomeratum, commonly known as the clustered African rosewood, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, aromatic foliage and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces small, red, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in coastal and rocky habitats, often forming dense thickets. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
